channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report I-2024050021
item.description:
Report I-2024050021

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: Santa Nella
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OAK HARBOR FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30110
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a CHP scale inspection the affected tote was observed"leaking" by CHP. Our driver was isolated from the trailers and was unable to provide any detail except for the attached picture. The discharge from the leak amounted to aboutl gallon which all remained within the confines of trailer Vl 157S. A Clean Harbors technician stated later the leak came from a small fracture on the bladder bag but he was unable to determine if it was caused by: Fatigue Overpressure/Over filling Age handling(including securement)

item.title: Report X-2024050049
item.description:
Report X-2024050049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON TAN BELT SPOT 189. THE PACKAGE WAS UPRIGHT ON GRATES. HAD AN OXIDIZER AND CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. HAD A UN SPEC # AND ORIENTATION ARROWS. SHIPPING PAPERS. DECISION TREE WAS FOLLOWED AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
